seo.title: Arienzo Beach Guide
seo.description: Reserve loungers, choose the shuttle boat or 300-step stairway, and plan food and transport for Arienzo Beach.

linkLabel: Arienzo Beach: Positano's Boutique Beach Club
intro: Arienzo sits just east of Positano with long afternoon sun, turquoise water, and a dramatic stairway down from the Amalfi Coast road. It is the liveliest lido within easy reach of Hostel Brikette, but between the stairs and reservation-only policies you want a plan before you set off.
Use this guide to lock in your spot, choose whether to ride the shuttle boat or walk the 300 steps, and budget for lunch, drinks, and the ride home.

sections.title: Why Arienzo works for Hostel Brikette guests
body: Arienzo is the closest full-service beach club outside the crush of Spiaggia Grande. The cliffside terraces catch sunlight until early evening, the water stays clear for swimming, and the bar keeps the party atmosphere without tipping into nightlife territory.

You can split your group between packages that include loungers and lunch or reserve a front-row deck for a splurge day. With some planning you dodge queues and still be back at the hostel before sunset drinks on the terrace.

sections.title: Getting there: shuttle boat or 300 steps
body: The easiest route is the Arienzo Beach Club shuttle boat that departs from Spiaggia Grande. Boats run roughly every 30 minutes from 09:30, with the last outbound ride around 13:30. Your reservation confirmation includes a QR code—show it on the dock and keep the return schedule handy.

Walking is possible if you prefer to avoid the boat. Take the SITA bus towards Amalfi (board at the Sponda stop 10 minutes downhill from the hostel) and hop off at the signed Arienzo stop. From there descend 300 stairs through lemon terraces to reach the club entrance.
Arriving by car or scooter is discouraged; parking is extremely limited and traffic police fine vehicles that block the bends.

sections.title: Layout and beach operators
body: The main deck belongs to Arienzo Beach Club with orange loungers, towel service, freshwater showers, and a lively bar. A smaller free strip sits on the far right near the boat landing, but space disappears after 10:30 and you still need to manage the stairs with all your gear.
Sun reaches the first two rows until roughly 17:30 in summer before the cliffs cast shade. Ask staff to angle umbrellas as the light shifts, especially if you prefer a full day of tanning.
Freshwater showers, lockers, and changing cabins are included with the day packages. Wi-Fi is patchy; download playlists or ferry updates before you arrive.

sections.title: Packages, dining, and reservations
body: Standard day beds start around €70 for two people and include umbrella, towels, two welcome drinks, and the shuttle boat. Front-row platforms and prestige cabanas push €120–€200 depending on the month.
Lunch is served from 12:30 with seafood pasta, salads, and grilled mains. Expect €18–€28 per dish; reserve a table when you check in to avoid the 14:00 rush.

Bookings are handled directly through Arienzo’s website or by messaging their WhatsApp line. Payment details secure your spot; cancellations within 48 hours usually incur a fee, so confirm the weather forecast and ferry plans first.

sections.title: Heading back to Hostel Brikette
body: Return boats leave Arienzo on the half hour starting around 15:00; the final shuttle normally departs at 18:00 but times shift during shoulder season—double-check the board near reception.

If you walked down, allow 15–20 minutes to climb the stairs to the road. Buses towards Positano pass every 30–40 minutes in the afternoon; validate your ticket on board and have a spare for late returns.
Need a night swim? Pre-arrange a taxi pick-up through reception or the digital concierge, as ride-hailing apps do not operate reliably along the coast.

essentials: Mandatory reservations in peak season—book online or via WhatsApp before leaving the hostel.
Choose between the shuttle boat from Spiaggia Grande or the 300-step stairway from the SITA bus stop.
Full-service lido with bar, restaurant, showers, and towel service included in day packages.
typicalCosts: Day bed for two with shuttle boat: €70–€90 depending on season.
Front-row platform or cabana: €120–€200 for two guests.
tips: %LINK:arienzoBeachBusBack|Getting back from the beach by bus%.
Screenshot your booking confirmation; mobile signal fades along the stairway and at the dock.
Pack a reusable water bottle—refills are available at the bar and keep costs down on hot days.
Compare other coastal options in our %LINK:positanoBeaches|beaches overview% if you want a quieter or free alternative.
warnings: No cash refunds for late arrivals; call ahead if you are running behind so staff can hold your loungers.
The free section is extremely small and still requires navigating the full staircase with your gear.
Wave conditions occasionally pause the shuttle boat—staff will text updates, but have the bus plan ready.

faqs.q: How far in advance should I reserve?
a: Book at least three to five days ahead in June–September, especially for weekend slots or front-row platforms. Shoulder season (April, May, October) often has next-day availability but still confirm the shuttle schedule.

faqs.q: Can I visit without buying a package?
a: Yes, but options are limited. A small public strip sits beside the club and fills by mid-morning. You will not have access to bathrooms or showers without a package, and you must still manage the long stairway.

faqs.q: What should I wear for the stair climb?
a: Wear sturdy sandals or trainers for the descent. Carry heavier items in a backpack and pause at the midway landings. On the way back up, take breaks in the shade and hydrate before boarding the bus or taxi.
